qas.question: Does everyone agree on the credit that should be given for the story of Mary's inception ?

answers.text: Others have rejected that the doctrine of Immaculate Conception exists in Islam

qas.question: What does the book of Muslim faith state in regards to how every person is born ?

answers.text: in Islam every human child is born pure and immaculate

qas.question: Does this view contradict the belief that Mary was also born to a virgin mother ?

answers.text: her sinless birth is thus independent of the Christian docrtrine of original sin as no such doctrine exists in Islam

qas.question: What view did the Qua-ran take on the sinful ways in which Mary could have been conceived ?

answers.text: Muslim tradition or hadith, which states that the only children born without the "touch of Satan," were Mary and Jesus.

qas.question: What is the name of the prayer that is listed in the Qua-ran  is used to enact a safeguard on kids from the  the devil ?

answers.text: Hannah's prayer in the Quran for her child to remain protected from Satan

plausible_answers.text: every human child is born pure and immaculate

qas.question: How does the Qur\an confirm the Immaculat Conception of Mary?
What does the Qur'an say is dependent on Christian doctrine?

plausible_answers.text: after it had already been born

qas.question: When did Mary pray for her child to remain protected from Satan?
Who does the hadith refer to as servents?

context: <a0_0>Others have rejected that the doctrine of Immaculate Conception exists in Islam<a0_0/>, the Quranic account does not confirm the Immaculate Conception exclusively for Mary as <a1_0>in Islam <b5_0>every human child is born pure and immaculate<b5_0/><a1_0/>, <a2_0><b6_0>her sinless birth<b6_0/> is thus independent of the Christian docrtrine of original sin as no such doctrine exists in Islam<a2_0/>. Moreover, <a4_0>Hannah's prayer in the Quran for her child to remain protected from Satan<a4_0/> (Shayṭān) was said <b7_0>after it had already been born<b7_0/>, not before and expresses a natural concern any righteous parent would have. <b8_0>The <a3_0>Muslim tradition or hadith<b8_0/>, which states that the only children born without the "touch of Satan," were Mary and Jesus.<a3_0/> should therefore not be taken in isolation from the Quran, and is to be interpreted within the specific context of exonerating Mary and her child from the charges that were made against them and is not a general statement. The specific mention of <b9_0>Mary and Jesus<b9_0/> in this hadith may also be taken to represent a class of people, in keeping with the Arabic language and the Quranic verse [O Satan] surely thou shalt have no power over My servants, except such of the erring ones as choose to follow thee (15:42)
